intro: Luma oxysepala, commonly known as the white luma, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Luma oxysepala is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
